isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Assembly and Installation - Install Wheel Bearings in Hub

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions provided by the press manufacturer to avoid damage to components and serious personal injury.

step1.para: If wheel studs were removed from the hub, put the hub in a press with the drum side at the bottom. Align the grooves on the studs with the grooves in the stud holes in the hub. Press the studs into position.

note.para: If a press is not available, use a brass hammer.

warning.para: Do not hit the hubs with a steel hammer. Damage to the parts can occur and broken parts can cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Install the inner and outer bearing cups into the hub. Use a press and sleeve.
Fill the bearing cones and hub cavity with the correct grease until it is level with the inside diameter of the bearing cones. Refer to Lubrication, Inspection and Maintenance Section.
Install the inner bearing cone in its cup inside the hub.
